de.unisiegen.tpml.core.interpreters
Interface Store

All Superinterfaces:
Environment<Location,Expression>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultStore
public interface Store
extends Environment<Location,Expression>

Base interface to stores used in the big and small step interpreters to implement memory operations. A store basicly maps Locations to Expressions, i.e. for every location present within a store, the expression at the specified location can be determined.

Version:
$Rev: 279 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
Location

Methods inherited from interface de.unisiegen.tpml.core.util.Environment
containsSymbol, get, symbols
 

Method Detail

containsLocation

boolean containsLocation(Location location)
Returns true if this store contains the specified location.

Parameters:
location - the Location whose existance within this store to test.
Returns:
true if the location is present within this store.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the given location is null.
See Also:
Environment#containsSymbol(S), Environment#get(S)

locations

Enumeration<Location> locations()
Returns an enumeration of the Locations within this store, in the reverse order of their allocation. That is, the last allocated Location is returned first by the enumeration.

Returns:
an enumeration of the Locations within this store.
See Also:
Environment.symbols()

alloc

Location alloc()
Allocates a new Location within this store. This method is used to implement the ref operator in the big and small step interpreters, which requires a new location that has not been allocated before.

Returns:
a new Location within this store.
See Also:
containsLocation(Location)

put

void put(Location location,
         Expression expression)
Adds a new mapping for the expression to the location. If there is already a mapping for the location the previous mapping is deleted.

Parameters:
location - the Location for the expression
expression - the Expression.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if expression is not a value (see the description for the Expression.isValue() method).
NullPointerException - if either location or expression is null.
See Also:
alloc(), containsLocation(Location), Environment#get(S), Expression.isValue()
